title: ReactJS
description:
Description : Following the succesful April meetup, we are once again organizing a new gathering for front-end developers, this time around ReactJS.


10:00 - 10:10 :: Welcome
10:15 - 10:45 :: Keys in React by Saamiyah Peerun
10:50 - 11:30 :: Memoization in React by Zeeshan Maudar
11:45 - 12:45 :: Lunch
12:50 - 13:15 :: Hosting SPAs by Ish Sookun
13.20 - 14:00 :: Vite for Front-end Development by Sandeep Ramgolam


Rsvp link:
Facebook Group


Host: Sandeep Ramgolam


Covid Guidelines:

Please wear your mask at all times except during lunch and practice social distancing.

description:

• 11h00: "Vue.js Jumpstart" by Humeira Diljore

• 12h30: Open discussions
• 13h00: END

title: Front-End Coders Meetup
description:
**UPDATE**/n The Front-end Coders meetup scheduled for today has been postponed to next week due to bad weather conditions!


We are holding our first 2018 meetup at the offices of LSL Digital in Port-Louis. It’s a free event and everyone is welcome. Join us to discover presentations on topics including CSS grids and insights on how to freelance by members of our community and participate in coding activities. It is a great way to share ideas and meet like-minded people.

Schedule and plan :
12:30 - 12:50 : A keylogger using CSS only (Sun)
13:00 - 13:20 : Going Freelance ( Cedric )
13:30 - 13:50 : Discover CSS Grid
14:00 - 14:30 : Open Q&A and Coding Challenges

Food
We will provide a light snacks for attendees. Vegetarian options will be available. Alternatively, there are local shops and cafes nearby.

Tickets
This is a free event and seats are limited. Please RSVP.

Who are we?
Front-End Coders is a global community for web professionals and students which focuses on education, innovation and networking.

title: TypeScript: A gentle introduction
description:
Session 1 : Introduction to TypeScript by Saamiyah - Front-end Coders
Session 2: How KDE is perfect for you! by Privi - LUGM

TypeScript is a typed superset of javascript. It can be used across the whole JavaScript ecosystem, and works well with frameworks such as Angular, React, Vue and NodeJS.

It has been designed to meet the needs of JavaScript programming teams that build and maintain large JavaScript programs.

Come join us to learn about TypeScript and improve your understanding of the language.

Speaker: Saamiyah ~ Software developer @ Maureva LTD

---------------------------------------------------------------
How KDE is perfect for you!

From the Big Bang to KDE

An overview of the Technology underneath KDE and what makes it tick
Advanced usage of a Desktop and what you have been missing all these years

Introduction to plasma, plasmoids and qml

If possible create a KDE Hello world app as well as a webapp.
Speaker: Pritvi Jheengut - The one and only
---------------------------------------------------------------

Session 3 : Surprise !

title: Front-End Coders x MSCC
description:
Location
Makerspace / Generation Plus Ltd
Vacoas-Phoenix
https://maps.app.goo.gl/Z9sYP

Timing
Start time: 11:00 am
End time: 2:30 pm
Lunch: 12:20 pm - 1:10 pm

Slot details
Total duration: 40 min
Sections: setup - presentation - QnA

Presentations - Speakers

Christophe Ramsamy
“Introduction to Heroku, or how to send your pet projects to the cloud”

Bilkiss Dulloo
“Translating an angular application into a mobile app with ionic”

Rahul Thakoor
"Hardware programming for javascript developers?"

title: CSS / Web Components / FunctionalJS
description:
Front End Coders welcomes you to June's monthly meetup!
Join us for front-end talks and some announcements about tech scene!

Location
Techsphere Labs,
Moka
https://goo.gl/maps/b3mp3Aa57rfFFex8A

Date: 22 June 2019

Timing:
Start: 9:30 am
Finish: 2:00 pm
Lunch: 12:30 pm - 1:15 pm

No worries, lunch is on us! 😉

Max capacity: 25 attendees

Agenda:
- Three presentations
- Announcements

Line-up, Topic - Speaker:
CSS Name Spaces - Kushul Soomaree
Web Components - Cedric Poilly
Functional JavaScript - Christophe Ramsammy
"Tech Topic Discussions" - Sandeep Ramgoolam

Slot guidelines (40 min):
- presentation duration: 30 min
- Q & A duration: 10 min

title: Hacktoberfest x DevFest
description:
Let's get ready for October! Front-End Coders is there you help you get ready for the Hacktoberfest & the Google DevFest! ✌🏼

# Location:
Extension Interactive Maurice
14 Avenue des Lataniers, Quatre Bornes
https://maps.app.goo.gl/qcgwPuGKRqnnpWnu9

Date: 21 September 2019

# Timing:
Start: 10:00
Finish: 15:00

Max capacity: 25 attendees

# Agenda:
- Presentation & preparations for Hacktoberfest, with Pritvi! 🤘🏼
- Practice runs for Google DevFest: test your presentation & collect feedback. 😉

# FREE FOOD 🍕

title: Front-End Coders Monthly - Jan 2020
description:
Hello Front-End Coders!
Let's meet this Saturday and start 2020 with our first monthly meetup. ✌️

Thanks to Bocasay (https://www.bocasay.com/) & Tristan Hebert for hosting us!

Location
Bocasay (Maurice)
51A Rue du Savoir, Ebene 72201
https://maps.app.goo.gl/dvHE768DM2zonnoq5

Date: (POSTPONED) Tentatively Saturday 1st Feb

Contact:
Sandeep -[masked]
Cedric -[masked]

Timing:
Start: 10:00
Finish: 15:00

Max capacity: 20 people

Agenda:
- Discuss the yearly organisation of Front-End Coders
- Discuss potential activities as Front-End Coders for the DevCon
- Discuss Contributing to the Devcon(2020) website
- Practice runs for DevCon presentations

# FREE FOOD 🍕

title: Open Source / Promises / DevCon

Let's meet on the Saturday 15th of Feb and start 2020 with our first monthly meetup. ✌️

Contact:

- Discuss Contributing to the Devcon(2020) website - Sandeep Ramgolam
- Callbacks & Promises for asynchronous JavaScript - Cedric Poilly
- Practice runs for DevCon presentations - FFA (We already have one. Others are most welcome)

# FREE FOOD 🍕

title: Front-End Coders Monthly #2 - 21 Mar 2020
description:
⚠️ UPDATES 15/03/2020 ⚠️
---
Due to the current situation and for safety reasons. We think it's best that we avoid gatherings right now. We have decided to postponed the next front-end coders meetup. The next date will be communicated on meetup as usual. Let us know if you would be interested in an online meetup ?

Thank you for your understanding.
Wash your hands and stay safe
Front-end Coders Team
---

Hello Front-End Coders & Crafts(wo)men!

Let's meet on the Saturday 21st of March for FEC's second monthly meetup: a joint event with the MSCC! 🥳🎉

Thanks to Middlesex University Mauritius for hosting us!

Location
https://goo.gl/maps/FMxhexL8qqAWLwDy7

Contact:
Sandeep -[masked]
Cedric -[masked]

Timing:
Start: 10:30
Finish: 15:00

Max capacity:
TBD

Agenda:
- VueJS Mauritius
- JWT (JSON Web Token) from Back-End to Front-End (with Vue.js)
- PWAs: Beyond The Service Worker (with Vue.js)
- Basic Concept of React.js

# FREE FOOD 🍕

Logo.title: Mu Mauritius Logo 192px X 76px White Text.png

title: Vue3 / Nuxt / Vite
description:
Join us for an online meetup to talk about the front-end world and a few interesting topics !

# Topics
- NuxtJS Darkmode (Kushul)
- Vue 3 Portals / Teleport (Sandeep)
- Vite - vuejs, development without a bundler (Sandeep)
- Open discussion

Join on the following link:
https://meet.mscc.mu/FabulousFrontendFantasies

We only have simple rules:
- Kindly mute your mic when you're not speaking
- Use the chat to ask questions
- Be nice
- Be Friendly
- Be Courteous

title: VueJS Mauritius x Gopher Mauritius
description:
Join us for an online meetup to talk about the front-end world and a few interesting topics !

Also joining us will be GophersMU group to talk about go and do some small presentations.

- Exploring Vue Composition API (Sandeep)

title: Workshop by frontend.mu at DevCon2024
description:
In this workshop we will build a web app to display information about Power Outages in Mauritius

**Pre-requisites**
- Bring your laptop
- Install VS Code
- Install nodejs 18 or 20 with npm
- That's it !

We will use an open data source to retrieve the information and display it in a nice way using Nuxt 3 and TailwindCSS
Venue: Caudan Arts Centre, Pac Man Room
